channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Michelle Obama says she's a 'little angry' at the hesitation to vote for Harris
item.description: Polls show some Democrats aren't excited to vote for Vice President Harris. On Saturday, Michelle Obama railed against “the lie that we do not know who Kamala is or what she stands for."
item.content:encoded:
Polls show some Democrats aren't excited to vote for Vice President Harris. On Saturday, Michelle Obama railed against “the lie that we do not know who Kamala is or what she stands for."

(Image credit: Brendan Smialowski)
item.dc:creator: Deepa Shivaram

item.title: 'Washington Post' columnists push back against non-endorsement decision
item.description: In a joint column, 17 Post columnists called the paper's decision not to endorse a presidential candidate a "terrible mistake."
item.content:encoded:
In a joint column, 17 Post columnists called the paper's decision not to endorse a presidential candidate a "terrible mistake."

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Grammy-winning rapper Lil Durk is charged in murder-for-hire conspiracy
item.description: The Grammy Award-winning rapper, whose real name is Durk Banks, was arrested in Florida on federal charges that he paid for the attempted 2022 revenge killing of rapper Quando Rondo at a gas station.
item.content:encoded:
The Grammy Award-winning rapper, whose real name is Durk Banks, was arrested in Florida on federal charges that he paid for the attempted 2022 revenge killing of rapper Quando Rondo at a gas station.

(Image credit: Richard Shotwell)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Trump spent 3 hours on Joe Rogan's podcast. Here's what he did — and didn't — say
item.description: Trump’s freewheeling Joe Rogan podcast interview covered polls, whales and potentially replacing income taxes with tariffs, as he left Michigan rally goers waiting an extra three hours Friday night.
item.content:encoded:
Trump’s freewheeling Joe Rogan podcast interview covered polls, whales and potentially replacing income taxes with tariffs, as he left Michigan rally goers waiting an extra three hours Friday night.

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Stephen Fowler

item.title: Want a Picasso? UChicago students borrow original art for their dorms
item.description: College students often use posters to help spruce up their dorm. At the University of Chicago, they get a chance to borrow works by prominent artists for a year.
item.content:encoded:
College students often use posters to help spruce up their dorm. At the University of Chicago, they get a chance to borrow works by prominent artists for a year.

(Image credit: Alison Cuddy for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Alison Cuddy

item.title: Opinion: Nature dazzles in autumn
item.description: NPR's Scott Simon is dazzled by the turn of the seasons, especially the color of the leaves.
item.content:encoded:
NPR's Scott Simon is dazzled by the turn of the seasons, especially the color of the leaves.

(Image credit: Caroline Simon)
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: Centuries-old remains found in a well may be man from Norse saga
item.description: An old Norse story tells of a king's man being tossed down a well in 1197. An archeologist teamed up with an evolutionary genomicist to study DNA of a skeleton found in that well.
item.content:encoded:
An old Norse story tells of a king's man being tossed down a well in 1197. An archeologist teamed up with an evolutionary genomicist to study DNA of a skeleton found in that well.

(Image credit: Riksantikvaren (The Norwegian Directorate for Cultural Heritage))
item.dc:creator: Ari Daniel

item.title: Freeman hits 1st walk-off slam in World Series history as Dodgers top Yankees in Game 1
item.description: Freddie Freeman hit the first game-ending grand slam in World Series history in the 10th inning to give the Los Angeles Dodgers a 6-3 victory over the New York Yankees in a drama-filled opener.
item.content:encoded:
Freddie Freeman hit the first game-ending grand slam in World Series history in the 10th inning to give the Los Angeles Dodgers a 6-3 victory over the New York Yankees in a drama-filled opener.

(Image credit: Ashley Landis)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Remembering Dr. Richard Cash: How a 'simple' intervention helped save millions of lives
item.description: In the late 1960s, he went to Dhaka to work on cholera. There he became involved in the development of oral rehydration therapy — hailed as one of the most significant medical advances of the century.
item.content:encoded:
In the late 1960s, he went to Dhaka to work on cholera. There he became involved in the development of oral rehydration therapy — hailed as one of the most significant medical advances of the century.

(Image credit: Kent Dayton)
item.dc:creator: Joanne Silberner

item.title: Many state abortion bans include exceptions for rape. How often are they granted?
item.description: Since the Supreme Court struck down Roe v. Wade in 2022, one study estimates there’s been nearly 65,000 pregnancies from rape in states that ban abortion.
item.content:encoded:
Since the Supreme Court struck down Roe v. Wade in 2022, one study estimates there’s been nearly 65,000 pregnancies from rape in states that ban abortion.

(Image credit: Geoff Stellfox for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Katia Riddle
